text: It’s time for Congress to get back to work to get further relief to the American workers and families who need it. Let’s get this done. https://t.co/mnxKyLTJb7

We also asked these New Yorkers what they’re most worried about as they navigate life during this pandemic.

We’ll do our best to help alleviate these worries as best we can. https://t.co/F8qOHHF4Ex

According to recent reporting, states with significantly fewer cases of #COVID19 than New York are having requests for medical supplies from the federal stockpile filled completely, while New York’s hospitals wait. I’m demanding answers and transparency from President Trump: https://t.co/uzMdbn8q3I

New Yorkers: As we navigate #COVID19, I want to assure you that we’re in this together. My office has put together a set of resources—with information on the relief package that just passed Congress—that we'll update for the duration of the pandemic: https://t.co/9U8mbV0ias

My team and I put together a set of resources as New Yorkers navigate the #COVID19 pandemic, with guides to the coronavirus economic relief package and how it can help you. We'll update and share as we have new information: https://t.co/9U8mbV0ias

(And always make sure to follow guidelines from medical professionals.) https://t.co/paFQmiyJwG

While this is a good down payment in the fight against this outbreak, there is much more to be done. In the months ahead, I will continue working to deliver resources to help our country overcome this immense challenge.

Furthermore, it will give confidence to workers and families facing financial strain and enables them to follow public health guidelines. Importantly, the bill provides oversight of corporate loans, ensuring that funds are distributed responsibly fairly, and protecting workers.

I voted for the package because it strengthens our health care system and puts workers and families first—with critical funding for hospitals, expanded unemployment insurance, small businesses grants and loans, and resources for the state and local governments on the frontlines.

I just cast my vote for the coronavirus economic package. With this package, New Yorkers have more help on the way. It will deliver a surge of protective equipment and resources to New York hospitals and first responders, and put real dollars in New Yorkers' pockets.
Our country has extraordinary resilience. We will get through this crisis together—and we will come out of it even stronger. https://t.co/d2LzgcueMn

Every worker should have two weeks of paid sick leave. It's the right thing to do for our communities and for our economy, especially as the country grapples with this #COVID19 outbreak. 
 
https://t.co/BcQDVNbxzD

The Senate failed the American people today.
